qas.question: Buddhism's spread led to what large-scale effort?
How long did the translation effort take?
What Empire was especially good at translation?
What were the Tanguts able to do in only decades that took the Chinese centuries?
What small-scale effort was led to by the spread of Buddhism?
How long did the translation effort stop?
What Empire was not good at translation?
What were the Tanguts not able to do that took the Chinese centuries?

context: In <a0_0><b5_0>Asia<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the spread of Buddhism led to large-scale ongoing <a1_0>translation<a1_0/> efforts spanning <a2_0><b7_0>well over a thousand years<b7_0/><a2_0/>. <a3_0><b8_0>The Tangut Empire<b8_0/><a3_0/> was especially efficient in such efforts; exploiting the then newly invented block printing, and with the full support of the government (contemporary sources describe the Emperor and his mother personally contributing to the <b6_0>translation<b6_0/> effort, alongside sages of various nationalities), the Tanguts took mere decades to <a4_0><b9_0>translate volumes<b9_0/><a4_0/> that had taken the Chinese centuries to render.[citation needed]
